item.description:
A Singular Vision
Photographs by Arthur Griffin
The Griffin Museum at The Cambridge Homes
360 Mount Auburn St., Cambridge, MA
November 15 - January 18
Opening reception
Tuesday, November 16, 7:30-8:30 PM

photo: Â© Arthur Griffin

Arthur Griffin, founder of the museum in 1992, had a more than 60-year career as a photojournalist. Originally trained as an illustrator, he picked up his first camera in 1929. By the mid-1930s, he was the exclusive photographer of the new Boston Globe Rotogravure Magazine and the New England photojournalist for Life and Time magazines. During the golden age of photojournalism, the 1930s to the 1950s, he shot everything from street scenes to fashion, sports to celebrities, everyday life to war. Griffin, who became know as New England's photographer laureate, died in 2001 at age 97.

The reception is open to all.

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: A Singular Vision Photographs -- by Arthur Griffin (Opening reception)
